duck: yoke definition: a wooden bar or frame by which two draft animals (as oxen) are joined at the heads or necks for working together.
Yoke (clothing), part of the construction of a garment
Yoke (aircraft), Yoke is the term for the "wheel" that controls the ailerons and elevator on aircraft.
Shoulder pole, or Milkmaid's yoke, is a carrying device
Yoke (Lake District), a high point in Cumbria, England

Yoke - A yoke is a wooden beam, normally used between a pair of oxen or other animals to enable them to pull together on a load when working in pairs, as oxen usually do; some yokes are fitted to indi...
Six pack yoke, a plastic holder for beverage cans
Yoke (unit of measurement) used in the time of the Domesday Book for tax purposes in Kent

wiki.text:
]] A 'yoke' is a wooden beam, normally used between a pair of oxen or other
animals to enable them to pull together on a load when working in pairs, as oxen
usually do; some yokes are fitted to individual animals. There are several types
of yoke, used in different cultures, and for different types of oxen. A pair of
oxen may be called a yoke of oxen, and yoke is also a verb, as in "to yoke a
pair of oxen". Other animals that may be yoked include horses, mules, donkeys
and water buffalo.
wiki.title: yoke
